ETYMOLOGY: From Old French accusacion, from Latin accūsātiō, accūsātiōnem 'a formal complaint, an indictment', from accūsāre 'to accuse'.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [an accusation of sth/doing sth] | [an accusation against sb]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). It can be countable (e.g., one accusation, two accusations) or uncountable (e.g., information).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A charge or claim that someone has done something illegal or wrong.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 指控某人做错了事或违法了的说法或声明。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The manager denied all accusations of fraud.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经理否认了所有关于欺诈的指控。
